meanings.definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
meanings.sent1: She is a fastidious editor, always checking every comma and period.
meanings.sent2: The fastidious student double-checked his math homework to ensure it was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The fastidious chef refused to serve the dish until every garnish was in place.
meanings.sent4: Her fastidious nature when it comes to organizing her closet is like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The fastidious painter meticulously painted each stroke with precision.

meanings.definition: Very concerned about matters of cleanliness.
meanings.sent1: The fastidious housekeeper made sure every corner was spotless.
meanings.sent2: He was fastidious about washing his hands before every meal.
meanings.sent3: The fastidious cat groomed itself multiple times a day.
meanings.sent4: Her fastidiousness with hygiene was like a shield against germs.
meanings.sent5: The fastidious janitor meticulously cleaned every surface in the building.

meanings.definition: Showing or demanding excessive delicacy or care.
meanings.sent1: The fastidious artist spent hours perfecting the tiny details of the painting.
meanings.sent2: She had a fastidious approach to choosing the right fabric for her dress.
meanings.sent3: The fastidious collector refused to display his rare stamps in direct sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His fastidious taste in music made him a harsh critic of mainstream pop songs.
meanings.sent5: The fastidious gardener carefully pruned each flower to maintain its beauty.
